topic.title: Role Based Admin Access (RBAC)
topic.shortdesc: Full Couchbase administrators can manage role-based access for administrators (RBAC) using REST API.

section.title: GET /settings/rbac/roles
section.p: This command retrieves information about the available admin roles.

section.title: GET /settings/rbac/users
section.p: This command retrieves information about the current users and roles assigned to them.

section.title: PUT /settings/rbac/users/<user_id>
section.p: This command sets names and roles for specified user IDs.

section.title: DELETE /settings/rbac/users/<user_id>
section.p: This command deletes user specified with an ID.

dlentry.dd:
Returns array of objects like this one: {"role":"admin", "name":"Admin", "desc": "Can manage ALL cluster features including security."}
or with extra property "bucket_name":"default" if the role is parametrized.

dlentry.dt: Get list of users and roles assigned to them.

dd.p: The list does not include built-in users.

In the following example, the output of the command shows that John Doe was assigned to the role of the Bucket Administrator for the default bucket , while Alice Smith is the Replication Administrator.

dlentry.dt: Set names and roles for specified user IDs <user_id>
